text: hi this is Niharika and welcome back to
a new lesson well do you think your
resume needs an update
well it does need an update if it has
words that are overused and most of the
HR people or the hiring managers are
literally done looking at them because
most of the resumes at least that's what
I have observed are like these ticket of
Deadwood words the words that are so
overused that it just loses the real
meaning so it's important for you to
choose your words correctly wisely
because a resume is a presentation of
your work and yourself so here is a list
of words and phrases for you that you
need to avoid okay so we are going to
start with the first one that is
communication skills well have you
observed people writing in their resume
that I'm good at communication skills
really okay and why can't you use this
well because the real meaning of
communication skills is that you are
able to speak but why do you have to
mention that in your resume if your
resume is well written then it's
inevitable that your communication
skills would be great because you can't
really judge yourself by saying oh I am
great at communication skills so that's
exactly the reason why you need to avoid
writing this in your resume if you are
selected for a personal interview okay
and you go for an interview you get a
chance to show off your communication
skills so concentrate
on writing a good resume and please do
not write that you are good at
communication skills all right the next
one is skillful skillful or in fact many
people write I am really great in my
skills doesn't make sense at all because
your skills are not going to be showed
in a resume right for an employer or for
a hiring manager it makes no sense when
he reads that you are skillful it
doesn't make any sense and the reason
because none of your skills can be
proven in a resume so why include that
in your resume and even if you want to
then please back it up with some
examples that would show off your skills
clearly okay so please make sure to
avoid using the word I am skillful or
I'm great at problem-solving skills okay
subdue avoid that then the third one is
hard-working Julie are you hard-working
well most of the people I come across
are very hard-working
be it my maid my electrician my plumber
they all are hardworking people so why
would you add this in your resume
isn't it obvious that if you are gonna
work for a company then you are gonna
put all your efforts so why show it off
in your resume okay doesn't make a good
impression to the employer so please do
not write that
I am hardworking and even if you want to
show that how hard-working you are then
please back it up with examples okay the
other one is detail-oriented okay
detail-oriented I'm sorry for the
spelling error its detail-oriented now
now many people really work closely like
they are extremely detailed oriented
which is a great thing I'm not saying
that it's a bad point but when you add
it in your resume again it doesn't make
any sense to the employer because he
will wonder then what kind of detailed
work you can do okay he would just not
understand why you have included this in
your resume but yes when it comes to a
personal interview you can mention this
and even when you're mentioning it
please tell him about that about your
past experience and how it would benefit
the employer by he or she or by you
being detail-oriented okay so please
avoid this word in your resume but when
you go for a personal round do say it
next one is experience walking in most
of the people in the resume do mention
this but experience is something that
happens to you you go through it so it's
your experience putting that in a resume
makes no sense so please avoid this in
fact instead of writing your experience
or your background if you want to really
mention it in your resume then make it
by saying your achievements okay so you
can use the term achievements but please
avoid experience in your resume because
this is something that you go through
okay it happens to you your employer
would not understand it but when he
reads achievements he knows or she knows
what you mean okay and then the last one
is highly motivated everyone loves to
say that how motivated you are but avoid
this putting it on your resume if you
write
um that learning and acquiring new
skills makes me feel motivated then yes
I understand that it makes sense but by
just saying I'm highly motivated makes
no sense in the resume in fact it's
quite bizarre the employer would think
that why have you really put in this
phrase of course when you work for a
company it's important for you to be
motivated but putting it in your resume
he would not get a clue that what you
exactly mean okay so please avoid this
so these are certain words and phrases
that you need to avoid then you are
writing your resume okay and please
choose them wisely and let me know if
you need any help to update your resume
please keep writing in to us I'll be
